intro: Tetratheca procumbens, commonly known as the prostrate tetratheca, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, sprawling habit. The plant produces small, showy flowers that are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and have a rough, hairy texture. Tetratheca procumbens is often found in rocky or sandy soils in coastal and inland regions.
